Hey, I'm Zinzy Waleson, a person online and in Amsterdam. This here is a quiet street of the Internet where I come to link and think. I'm a researcher and designer making tools for people at work. Learn more about me, this website or what I'm up to now, say hello, or visit the archive.

My name

When my mother was pregnant with me, she first decided she was going to name me Chris if I was going to turn out to be a girl, after Chrissie Hynde from The Pretenders. Had I been a boy, my name would have been Stevie Wonder.

Upon seeing Nelson Mandela on television, however, she quickly decided she was going to name me after his daughter Zindzi. A white woman pregnant by a Sao Tomean man, she wanted to honor my Africanness by naming me after a South African woman. I also imagine she must have thought the original spelling was too ethnic.

This website is part of the IndieWeb. If you'd like to learn what that means to me, as well as find out more about the structural setup of this website, please visit the colophon.
